definition: (China's) War of Resistance against Japan (1937-1945)
to resist/to fight/to defy/anti-
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
to fight/fight/war/battle
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Sino-Japanese War period, the County is the coexistence of two regimes.
sentences.chinese: 抗日战争时期，县境基本上是两种政权并存。

sentences.english: KMT-CCP cooperation ensured the War against Japan .
sentences.chinese: 国共合作是抗日战争胜利的根本保证。

sentences.english: Sino-Japanese War early, Linfen in Shanxi Province for seven administrative districts in the 6th District.
sentences.chinese: 抗日战争初期，临汾为山西省7个行政区中的第6区。

sentences.english: Huang Gang is the rising reporter star during the War of Resistance against Japan.
sentences.chinese: 黄钢是中国抗日战争中升起的一颗记者新星。

sentences.english: It happened during the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 事情发生在抗日战争的时候。

sentences.english: The Chinese Anti-Japanese war began the earliest and lasted the longest, and was the determinant in defeating Japanese Fascists.
sentences.chinese: 中国抗日战争是世界反法西斯战争的东方主战场。

sentences.english: The anti-Japanese war is essentially a peasant war.
sentences.chinese: 抗日战争，实质上就是农民战争。

sentences.english: This produced negative infection to the Anti-Japanese War afterward.
sentences.chinese: 对后来的抗日战争也产生了消极的影响。

sentences.english: Educational cause was one of the important battlefronts in the period of anti-Japanese war.
sentences.chinese: 教育事业是抗日战争时期对敌斗争的一条重要战线。

sentences.english: It is where Fighting Japaness War brouk out.
sentences.chinese: 这里是抗日战争暴发的地方。

sentences.english: In 1937 the Chinese people threw themselves into an all-out war of resistance against Japanese aggression.
sentences.chinese: 一九三七年，中国人民开始了全民族的抗日战争。

sentences.english: During the period of the War of Resistance Against Japan, he refused to act for the Japanese invaders.
sentences.chinese: 在抗日战争时期，他曾拒绝为日本侵略者演戏。

sentences.english: Last night I saw a very good film, which was about the Anti-Japanses War.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我看了一部很好的电影，它是关于抗日战争的。

sentences.english: During the Anti-Japanese War, the Soviet Union was on the side of China.
sentences.chinese: 在抗日战争中，苏联站在中国一边。

sentences.english: During the Sino-Japanese war, Chee Kwon spent 9 months in Yan'an.
sentences.chinese: 抗日战争期间，陈志昆在延安生活了9个月。

sentences.english: My father became an army officer during the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲在抗日战争时是个军官。

definition: war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Chinese Civil War, also known as War of Liberation 解放戰爭|解放战争[Jie3 fang4 Zhan4 zheng1]
Resist US, help North Korea (1950s slogan)
to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
nationalist forces
Huaihai Campaign (Nov 1948-Jan 1949), one of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War, considered the determining battle of the war
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
Korean War (1950-1953)
Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
Great Victory at Pingxing Pass, ambush of Japanese troops by Communist forces on September 25, 1937 at 平型關|平型关[Ping2 xing2 guan1]
National Revolutionary Army
Battle of Mt Mengliang in Shandong of 1947 between the Nationalists and Communists
